title: Quiz 5: Traditional & Clinical Teaching Methods
description: Assess your knowledge of selecting and applying various teaching methods, including their advantages and disadvantages.

questions.question: Match the teaching method to its primary advantage:
questions.explanation: Lectures save time; Demos show 'how'; Role play builds empathy; Field visits show reality.

questions.question: Which method involves a small group of experts discussing a topic in front of an audience?
questions.explanation: A Panel Discussion involves experts conversing/discussing before an audience. A symposium involves set speeches.

questions.question: What are the disadvantages of the Lecture method?
questions.explanation: Lectures are passive, impersonal, and ignore individual learning speeds.

questions.question: The optimal number of students for a tutorial is not more than ___BLANK___.
questions.explanation: Small groups of 8 or fewer allow for effective interaction in tutorials.

questions.question: Order the steps in conducting a Demonstration:

items.text: Demonstrate the whole procedure at normal speed

questions.question: Simulation allows students to make mistakes safely without harming patients.
questions.explanation: Simulation provides a safe, risk-free environment for practice.

questions.question: Which discussion method involves the rapid generation of ideas without immediate criticism?
questions.explanation: Brainstorming focuses on quantity of ideas first, evaluation later.

questions.question: What is the term for teaching in a practical setting similar to the future work environment?
questions.explanation: Clinical teaching occurs in hospitals or clinics where students learn to care for patients.

questions.question: What is the 'Snowball Discussion' technique?

options.text: Pairs join to form fours, then eights, etc.
One person talks at a time

questions.hint: Getting bigger like a rolling snowball.

questions.question: Field visits are highly economical in terms of time and resources.
questions.explanation: Field visits are expensive and time-consuming to organize.
